## January 19 - Introductions

Introductions to class, to each other, to data feminism, to projects, and to R (phew!). Bring a laptop with R and RStudio installed! [Instructions for installing R, RStudio, and all the tidyverse packages.](../install/)

*Key Reading*

* Catherine D'Ignazio and Laura Klein. 2019. *Data Feminism* (open draft version). MIT Press. [Introduction](https://data-feminism.mitpress.mit.edu/pub/frfa9szd/release/6)
* Washington, A. L., & Kuo, R. 2020. ["Whose Side are Ethics Codes On? Power, Responsibility and the Social Good."](https://dl.acm.org/doi/abs/10.1145/3351095.3372844) In *FAT 2020 - Proceedings of the 2020 Conference on Fairness, Accountability, and Transparency,* pp. 230-240.Association for Computing Machinery, Inc.

*Data Practice*

* James Scott. 2021. *Data Science in R: A Gentle Introduction.* [Chapter 1](https://bookdown.org/jgscott/DSGI/getting-started-in-r.html)
* Hadley Wickham and Garrett Grolemund. 2017. *R for Data Science.* O’Reilly. [Chapter 4](https://r4ds.had.co.nz/workflow-basics.html), [Chapter 8](https://r4ds.had.co.nz/workflow-projects.html)
